abstracts.cdata!:
This resettlement policy framework (RPF)
            looks at the land acquisition, and compensation
            requirements, resulting from implementation of the Water
            Supply and Sanitation Project for six cities in Iran,
            expected to enhance environmental and health conditions,
            improve life conditions, alleviate poverty, and increase
            coverage of sanitation services. The country's
            legislation stipulates land expropriation should make the
            maximum use of public land for public utility projects, but,
            unless required, only a minimal expropriation of private
            land would serve the interest of public utilities, in which
            case the Government shall be obliged to pay compensation, as
            awarded by an independent assessment. This RPF discusses the
            legal process, specifying the resettlement instruments
            prepared by the client have been prepared for each city
            concerned, making the purpose of the instruments clear,
            adding the instruments respond fully to the Bank's
            policy requirements in the context of this project. Whereas
            it is expected no major displacement of persons, residences,
            or economic enterprises will occur due to project
            implementation - only a minimal number of less than 20
            persons may be affected - land shall be expropriated through
            full compensation at market value, and, rights to
            compensation extend to owners, tenants, workers, or any
            person with any interest lost as a result of expropriation.
